alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Lamar; Marion (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 24 at 11:45PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Marion, northwestern Fayette and central Lamar Counties through 1215 AM CDT... At 1145 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Guin to near Bedford. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Winfield, Vernon, Sulligent, Guin, Brilliant, Glen Allen, Beaverton, Gu- Win, Blooming Grove, Lamar County Airport, Crews, Bedford, Bluff, Crossville, Twin, Gattman, Tucker, Bazemore, Wayside and Lamar County Public Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for central, northwestern and west central Alabama.
